I know it's a little late, but I meant to do this on
Christmas eve/day:

Oh come, oh come Emaaanuel,
and ransom captive Iiisreal,
which mourns in lonely eeeexile here,
until the son of Goood appears,
rejoice, rejoice, Emaaanuel,
shall come to thee oh Iiisreal.

.....*sigh* o.k. just get it over with, start with the
anti-religious flames because you falsely believe me
to be a radical.  Believe it or not I've often
defended such losing causes as evolution in the name
of partial creationism (it means God worked THROUGH
evolution and the seven days were symbolic)....o.k.
you can flame me about that to, but like it or not
evolution currently IS a losing cause, why, because
there are NO holes in creationism, it's to simple to
find holes in, just God made everything in a few days
and everything looked old even then, so while
evolution in my opinion is just as legitimate,
whenever a tiny hole appears the pure creationists can
beat both pure evolutionists and us partial
creationists over the head with it for two or three
decades until ninty percent of the world is on there
side.
  My defense of partial creationism against pure
evolutionism is simple though.  Before the Big Bang,
how did the so-called "primortial atom" get there.  I
mean infinately dense particals billions of times
smaller than normal atoms don't usually just pop out
of nowhere do they.  The only person I've ever heard
answer that was some nutcase astronomer who said
aliens from another dimension wanted to do a science
project and overloaded a black hole to start the big
bang, but then you can simply ask how did THEIR
primortial atom get there, and yes I do believe the
stories about alien abductions, but not that one.

--- "Nic <wingedwarrior41@...>"
<wingedwarrior41@...> wrote:
> Merry Christmas everybody and may your wishes come
> true! Unless they
> include someone's death, especially mine... :O
